comment: In some religions, wisdom is considered a gift granted by [[God]].

diff.*:
Line 4: Line 4:  
It is crucial to realize that a wise decision must often be made from incomplete [[information]]. This requires the chooser to know the way that situations (of any sort) usually turn out. Thus a wise decision must be correct and justified, but the justification need not be based on a true belief.
 
It is crucial to realize that a wise decision must often be made from incomplete [[information]]. This requires the chooser to know the way that situations (of any sort) usually turn out. Thus a wise decision must be correct and justified, but the justification need not be based on a true belief.
    −
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. A wise person is called a "sage."
+
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. In some religions, wisdom is considered a gift granted by [[God]].
  +   +
A wise person is called a "sage."
